description:
Value, flavor and atmosphere was excellent. Meat and seafood portions were large and fresh. 

This place just does hot pot the right way. There is nothing spectacular here but everything was good. The soup bases were clean without too much salt and msg, the food was fresh, and the atmosphere was comfortable. If you are just looking for an decent place to eat hot pot without the hassle of lines or high prices, this should be your number 1 choice. Surprisingly, the high quality beef was actually high quality and the seafood was extremely fresh tasting. That being said though, this is a new establishment and the quality might not maintain itself as time goes on. Around 23$ per person is absolutely worth the quality and comfort of this hot pot experience.
author: Raymond F.

description:
Food wise- more like a 3.5, but so cheap and good value so I bumped them up. Plus the patrons are mostly Chinese, so it must be at least sort of decent?! All you can eat for only $23! However, of all the meats we tried, only the waygu was decent - the other rib eye was a bit too chewy. Def get the wontons- pretty good! Good amount of veges available. We chose the wintermelon pork broth (yummy) and the secret spicy broth (pretty good but over time gets super spicy!)- I liked to mix the broth. 

Overall- ok for the price, would return!
author: Vivian D.

description:
Very biased service here. Restaurant is owned by Chinese owners - not very good English. Poor service, forgot several times to put in our orders, didn't notify us of last call, etc  food is good but for so many reasons I will not coming back here. 

p.s Good luck finding parking
author: Wes L.

description: Ok... Im updating my review to 4 star because both occasions when I order to go, the lady/owner is super nice,  food is pretty good(not the hot pot but their regular dishes) and price is reasonable. The hot pot here is ok .. Hot pot beef quality meet is a no but their other options are good plus its affordable and their soup Broth is good. My new to go place for good affordable to go food.
author: Christy V.

description: Finally got around to trying this spot when I found out they have AYCE hot pot here for only $23.99 per person. It was empty when I first walked in, but the workers here were super nice and welcoming. I chose the spicy miso broth and the secret spicy soup. You then pick the items off the list and at first glance, it looks like they have a huge variety, but most of their things on the list are sold out or they don't have any. They kinda have a sauce bar in the back, but not really. I don't think I would come back despite their good service because the food is just ehh. Not really worth $30 per person including tip.
author: Lisa W.

description:
This place gets busy during peak hours! That tells you it's good food, but try to beat the dinner rush. Service also slows down when they get busy too. Some dishes I ordered never arrived, but it wasn't an issue since I was so stuffed. 

I got the Chafing pot with soups 1 and 2. Not super strong in flavor, but I enjoyed the kick the spicy soup gave. Our first pot came with a fly in it, so they replaced it without much issue. 

I love their sauce station! So many ingredients- you basically can create any sauce you want. Minced garlic, peppers, creamy and clear sauces, etc. 

As far as ingredients go, everything we had was fresh! I only dislike they stack meat plates on top of another, since I don't know how clean the bottom of their plates are. Each portion is well-controlled too; I never felt tired of eating the same order and had stomach left for other things. I loved the quail eggs, pig blood and intestines, lotus root, shrimp paste, and beef balls with pork filling. 

It was impossible to try everything on the menu. I must return!
author: Amber T.

description:
Visited Mon, Feb 19 2017 @ 3PM (President's Day)

We ordered...
Main Meals: AYCE hot pot (half szechuan, half spicy miso)
...and spent: ~$25 per person

Service: We came during a slow hour so the service was great! They even told us we didn't have to worry about the 90 minute time maximum which they usually impose on AYCE because there were only a few other tables that they were looking after
Vibe: Casual, open areas, bright lighting, bamboo plants and asian vibes
Good for: Odd hour hot pot cravings, sauce experimenters

Overall verdict: Would come back again when they're not so busy to try more sauces and hot pot soups; soups were not as strong in flavor as some other hot pot places I've been to, but the sauce bar makes up for it. We ordered different cuts of the beef and pork and were pleased with the quality.
author: Diana C.

description:
This review is strictly for hot pot. Hot pot is offered in the evenings and I'm so excited because this is my new go to spot. 

My boyfriend and I love to hot pot or shabu and we know those are two entirely different things. Hot pot is great because it's more than just meat and veggies. You can order seafood, and at this restaurant, you can order appetizers too. So many options to choose from and I love having options to choose from. 

We went to Chef Li's twice in one week for their hot pot because we loved it that much. Anyways, they're never too busy, both times, we were given a table right away. Sadly, the parking can be difficult, just don't be afraid to park a little further. 

After being sat down, we get a menu and dry erase marker and we just mark on the menu what we want. 

The first time we tried Chef Li's, we ordered a lot to try. The second time we came, we knew exactly what we wanted. 

Soup: Spicy miso and pork bone broth

-American Wagyu Beef (must get)
-Beef Ribeye (sometimes good, sometimes ok)
-New Zealand Lamb (love)
-Housemade Shrimp Paste (ok, wish it was more succulent)
-Rock cod Fish Fillet (THE SOFTEST FISH FILLET EVER)
-Fried Bean Curd (sometimes called fried tofu skin, MHM)
-Fish balls w/ roe (no good, it's like cheesy inside, not the one I usually like)
-Housemade shrimp wonton (must try)
-Spinach or napa cabbage (pretty fresh & clean)
-Flat potato noodle (clear flat noodle)
-Green onion pancake (really really oily)
-roast pork (not bad)
-Deep Fried Wonton (the wonton skin was thick, no good)
-Chinese Donut (really oily as well, I think re-fried)

Everything is really good for the price. We pay $23.99 each and it's a steal! We love it! 

Must try their chinese food one time. I've heard positive things about it.
author: Joey C.

description:
This place was packed when we came in. Luckily there was one table when we got there, then a long line started forming......

We ordered off the menu and marked what we wanted. It took awhile to get everything out on time. I think the workers were very frazzled because there wasn't that many of them. Our order got lost along the way......

Something's to mention, the duck wing is cooked but frozen and needs to be put in the pot. It was super yummy.

We got a bunch of the sauces they made on the side. We tried it all but nothing stood out in taste.

My bf and I got the complimentary ice tea, which was good. 

The very big downside was we weren't serviced well, and we also got bad bubble guts while we were eating. Maybe from the frequent putting in raw meat in the pot? We have had korean BBq and never had that problem. Maybe something wasn't sanitary, or meat wasnt good quality. There was also hair on the green onion pancake. We ate the ones without hair, and it was good. Such a shame. Maybe hot pot isn't my thing.....
author: Lynn C.

description:
I came here for my birthday on a Sunday night. We had a party of 11 (two of them were kids) and they were able to accommodate us with no problems. The restaurant is much larger on the inside than the photos so don't let that discourage you from bringing the entire family for hot pot. They'll make your entire party fit if needed. 

All you can eat hot pot is only available in the evenings starting at 5:30pm. If you get here right on the dot there will be no wait at all. Otherwise make sure you have reservations because the restaurant can get pretty busy as the night goes on. You order off a menu with a dry erase marker (so you can reuse this if you need to order more food). Their grand opening special includes milk tea! Be sure to take advantage of that with unlimited refills to boot. We ordered a ton of food and managed to finish it all without penalties. They warn that you will be charged for wasting food since it can't be re-served to other customers. Definitely load up on the American Wagyu beef and the lamb as it's super good. Their appetizers are also winners. Be sure to get the duck wings, Chinese fried donut, and the green onion pancake. 

During the day they have an a la carte menu and BBQ food to go if that's your thing. Otherwise come by in the evening for AYCE hot pot. That's what most people were doing.

Priced at $23.99/person is like a steal and they're in my neck of the woods. Credit cards are accepted here.
author: Tim G.

description:
Finally a reasonable price for hot pot in SF! Hot pot is one of my favorite meals but it's so expensive for AYCE all around the city! I was on the hunt to find a cheaper alternative AYCE hot pot and luckily I stumbled upon this place! $22.99 per person for AYCE! What an amazing price!

Food: the food was good! The meat was fresh, veggies were clean, and the unlimited milk tea was AMAZING! Definitely try the Jasmine milk tea! The broth options were okay, I got the pork bone broth and my boyfriend got the miso soup. Both are worth trying! 

Service: it was okay. The ladies were nice but they rarely checked up on us and we had to hunt them down to order again. Some of our orders never came in and we constantly kept requesting them but it never came. When it was time to pay, we waited 10 minutes and no one was helping us! but that's okay it was a little busy. ps they accept card!

Overall, I definitely would come back again! It's a little further from where I live but I would make the trip to come out again!
author: Katty X.

description: The most of their hotpot soup taste bad, beef not fresh, all kinds of ball food taste weird , as shrimp ball, beef ball fish ball ....! The most of tricky thing is when u order the foods in " in all u can eat hotpot " few of highest price foods they would say ran out !  I don't like eating hotpot there !!
author: Bing L.

description:
I'm always wary of hot pot restaurants namely because it's way cheaper to just do hot pot at home (assuming you have the asian portable stove with a pot with a center divider set up going). Chef Li's Cafe's pricing is about as much as I expect any other hot pot restaurant to go for but the quality and diversity of ingredients probably makes it stand out a bit more. 

For starters, the soup broths were pretty standard, you get one spicy one non-spicy (that my friends and I ultimately never eat out of so we always lament not getting full on spicy broths). Since this is ayce hot pot, you can go ham on the ingredients. Fish tofu, lamb, beef, napa cabbage, fish balls of every possible assortment, more tofu, enoki mushroom, and every noodle possible. The sauces are all self serve too and they also got a nice variety of sauces though the standard for me is satay, garlic, cilantro, some vinegar and an egg mixed in (it's a self-made concoction, not an available sauce). 

For what you pay for, I'd say this is a decent hot pot spot that doesn't get crazy crowded. Usually.
author: Derek T.

description:
$25 per person. Pretty good value considering it's AYCE that includes hot pot, milk teas, some appetizer/dim sum items. There are multiple flavors of milk tea like black, green, jasmine, etc. And they're not super sweet either, so I had the jasmine milk tea and it was pretty nice for cutting any spice. As for the dim sum items, we tried the mantou with condensed milk and roasted duck chin & wings. There are lots of soup bases to choose from and they have the split hot pot too. We tried the parsley with tofu & preserved egg plus the secret spicy soup bases. The secret spicy base wasn't that spicy. Sauces and condiments are in the back and there's a wide variety. They even have some housemade sauces like chili and satay. I loved the whole shrimps, clams, and mussels. OK breadth of seafood offerings. As for veggies, they were fresh and plentiful as well. The a choy, napa cabbage, watercress, eggplant, enkoi mushroom were all fresh and not wilted. Excellent meat and meatball options. I loved the egg and quail eggs, but even more they had several cuts of lamb and pork belly. The rib eye was good too.
We tried the housemade wontons and dumplings, which was for the hot pot, not pre-cooked. Pretty good. I liked that there were many housemade items here. Menu is really easy to read and helpful.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
No frills AYCE hotpot joint. Though they need to work on sourcing better quality of ingredients.

PRICE: AUCE hotpot with unlimited milk tea drinks is priced at $22.99, which is reasonable and average. 
PORTION: really small and inconsistent, which is okay since it's AYCE. An order or frozen tofu is 2 pieces, fish balls and quail eggs are 2-4 pieces. Meat rages from 4-6 pieces, vegetables on the other hand comes in a big basket. 
Quality: for the quality of food alone I'd give one star. Meat looks old or has been sitting out for a while. The fish balls with roe tasted synthetics and rotten. The milk teas are from powder mixes; it has no tea or milk. 
SERVICE: I spoke Chinese to the servers but I struggled to understand their english first. They are nice and service is fast because everything is pre-made.

Overall, I might give them another shot because we are a quick drive away, but if I've had this at home(China), I wouldn't never go back.
author: Tata X.

description: This place is does some serious Hot Pot. Wne you arrive you are greeted by friendly staff and shown a table. The menu is explained and you choose your broth and items you want to cook. Go make your sauce from the sauce ingredient buffet and get ready to eat. For $23 dollars you get to choose from BBQ meats, dumplings, pancakes and a ton of seafood, meat, balls, offal, veggies, and noodles for your broth. Sometimes you get things you didn't order so make sure you ask if you get something you don't recognize. Overall a fun and tasty experience.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Probably the first proper vegetarian review? No fancy vegetarian/vegan soup, but they can "make" you a soup on the spot, which is just... mushrooms and chinese leek/green onions (and some other flavoring), boiled in water, from scratch. I think it's actually the Beijing Style Clear soup. I guess that's what makes it "clear"

It's fine, because they have all these awesome veggies like prefried yam and mushrooms that you can just put in the soup and cook your own soup. And a ok variety of sauces (ask which ones are vegetarian, sesame is.) But be prepared to wait for a longer time since the soup is cooked from scratch and all the flavors wont get in until later.

But their veggie selection is really great! And cheaper than other AYCE hotpots. Still, I prefer a place where they already have a pre-cooked vegetarian/vegan soup.
author: Rao L.

description: Came here once with my friends around 3pm for hot pot..Not so many customers on that time 2 tables were occupied but the service was so bad  and lousy that  we had to flag them to take our order 5 times.. ending up leaving the place without even ordering..Will never  be coming back again..
author: Red P.

description:
Came here at 5PM on a Tuesday and there was no wait. The menu is almost exactly like Ipot's and it's 5$ cheaper so I really wanted to like this place, but it was just okay. 

Our table got the secret spicy soup and pork bone soup; the pork bone soup was really good and it comes with an actual pork bone (!!) but the spicy soup was pretty mediocre and not very spicy. The sauce bar was interesting b/c it had a lot of house made sauces and the meat/veggies seemed pretty fresh. 

The biggest downfall was the service. There were barely any tables eating at the same time as us, but it took a really long time for them to bring the plates that we ordered. Some of the plates we ordered never even came, even after reminding the waitress a bunch of times. Since the only way to get food at AYCE hot pot places like this is for the staff to bring it to you, it really makes the experience worse if you pay for AYCE for a set time period and end up having to wait ages for food.

Probably won't come here again even though it's way closer/cheaper.
author: Melissa H.

description: Nice restaurant and good service. Food is excellent, especially for the price point and the boss is very nice.
author: Anna A.

description: Hot pot must try!!! I got my own pot!! Excellent service .. I definitely will come back again... all you can drink milk tea too
author: Simon W.

description:
4.5 stars

I came here for their $22.99 AYCE hot pot and definitely did not leave disappointed!  Huge variety of broths and lots of meats, veggies, and side dishes.  Their fried chicken wings are surprisingly addictive and good.  You can also get a free bubble tea with every AYCE hot pot.  We came with a large party and sometimes it took a while for our orders to come out, but it was nonetheless a pleasant experience.

I've also come here several times for take out and to eat-in.  They have a pretty large menu.  The atmosphere is pretty casual but they make excellent take out.  Really crazy affordable prices for San Francisco and good, authentic Chinese food.  Reasonable amount of oilyness (relative to other Chinese restaurants) and very generous portions.  My favorite dishes:

- #123: Bean Curd Skin w/ Rock Cod and Roasted Pork - Wow. This dish is just all levels of deliciousness.  I mean, I love the chewiness of bean curd skin and I love fish casseroles (I use this word in the Chinese sense...more like stew).  They are generous with the amount of fish they give.  It also includes some other mixed veggies and wood ears (err...it's like a mushroom/fungus and it's chewy/crunchy if you're not familiar with it).  Best part is the savory roast pork that is also included.  Really, this is always a hit and a must-order!

- #60: Beef Chow Foon - I always order this dish at Chinese restaurants to gauge quality.  They had a good level of oilyness--not too much to overpower the dish, but enough to keep the noodles separated.  Savory and plentiful.
(We've also tried some other noodle dishes and have been satisfied with them all.)

- #168 - Braised Tofu with Vegetables - Yummy dish and a nice way to get a variety of veggies in my diet!

They are really nice too...even if their English is sometimes limited.  Hope they stick around because this is our go-to place for Chinese food!
author: Jess Y.

description:
$23.00 per person, free milk tea (Thai, taro, jasmine or bubble), wide variety of meats, seafood, dim sum & other appetizers. 

Service is excellent--the ladies work super fast. Best of all, they don't enforce a time limit & don't even charge for not finishing your food. Overall amazing experience.
author: Sara O.

description:
We came here for dinner last Monday. We were one of two tables at 6pm. 

I like that you can get your own personal hot pot or have one communal hot pot. I haven't seen that before. There are so many options for broth, meat, veggies, etc. They have a good variety of appetizers. I absolutely love that they have a sauce bar that is well stocked that doesn't cost extra. Plus all you can drink milk teas! All of this for the great price of $23/per person without taxes and gratuity. 

We were one of two tables in the entire restaurant and I guess one of the waitresses must have been in training because she kept bringing us their food. I think we got their 4-5 plates of meat as well as other dishes. We kept asking her what it was and I told her that we didn't order it but she was adamant that it was ours or couldn't describe what it was. The first waitress we met was much more knowledgeable and friendly. 

Ever since moving to the SF area, it has taken time to get used to the higher food prices but I am so glad to have found a hot pot place that is so much more reasonable/comparable to Chicago. I wouldn't come during a busy time like Friday/Saturday night because I don't know what kind of service you would receive. But I would definitely come back with a group of friends for a laid back AYCE meal.
author: Lily Z.

description:
Ehhhhhh. There are better places than this one. There isn't a place like this in the neighborhood so I guess that's why people would come here since its near their home. It's also kind of cheap? $22 a person. However, I don't mind driving 20 minutes to sunset or San Mateo where there are better hot pot places. 

I appreciate the sauce bar they have so that's good. But the meats, vegetables, and other items are okay. It was kind of gross that they don't strain the water off the plates of food. I guess it just depends but presentation is the least they could do. The soup base was okay, not too special or flavorful. TBH, their display of roasted chickens, ducks, pork, and etc looks better than the hot pot lol.
author: Joyce S.

description:
$22.99 for AYCE hot pot? I'm all for it! 

From the outside, the restaurant doesn't look like much and I would have never guessed that it was a hot pot restaurant but the inside is well lit and spacious. Nothing fancy about it but I always like places that have their burners inside the table and not on top. Some of the tables only had one burner for a shared pot and others had small burners for individual pots. I was surprised to see that there were 17 different broths to choose from! We opted for the pork bone and the special spicy soup. The pork bone broth had a funny smell and taste to it so it wasn't quite to my liking. I ended up cooking most of my food in that one anyway because the special spicy soup was wayyy too spicy and I felt like my lips were on fire throughout my meal - and this is coming from a spice lover. Just beware if you order it! 

There's a wide variety of meat, vegetables, fish/meat balls, and noodles. The meats came out first and my favorite was the Kurobuta pork. The wagyu was alright but the Australian lamb was too chewy. We had already finished our first round of meat before the rest of our items came out. The meat portions were smaller than I would've liked and I guess they only let you order three at a time because they put them on a 3-tier rack. During the second round we ordered four meats and we were only given three. The second time we ordered the kurobuta pork all the pieces were super fat to the point we thought we ordered pork belly. Service was a bit too slow which made it harder for us to order more meat and they forgot a couple of items that we asked for. The food quality was overall okay, but since I didn't like the broths, it made the rest of the food a bit "eh". 

There is a sauce bar in the back corner that has a lot of different sauces that you can mix together. I really enjoyed their house-made soy sauce! They also offer free milk tea (taro, Thai, regular, or jasmine) along with your meal and although that sounded like a great idea at first, I think it's a ploy to get you full faster off drinking their sweet milk tea, lol! (It's unlimited refills too) (I might be wrong) But I must admit it did compliment my meal well. For $22.99, it's definitely a great deal for hot pot but there is lots of room of improvement!
author: Cecille W.

description:
4.5 STARS

Lyft driver: "So, where are you from?"
Me: "San Francisco, you?"

Lyft driver: "OMG - ME TOO!!! We're like unicorns!"
Me: "Right?!"

Lyft driver: "What area did you grow up at?"
Me: "Portola."

Lyft driver "Ohhh, West Portal or Twin Peaks?"
Me: "Neither."

Lyft driver: "Uhhh, you said you're from SF right?"

Portola is a little unknown neighborhood in SF that flies under the radar. So much so that Yelp labeled it as the Excelsior...which is about 15 blocks away (they've since updated it). 

It should come as no surprise that Portola is not a destination place when it comes to food. Most restaurants on San Bruno Avenue are sadly, a bunch of dirty, greasy Chinese and Vietnamese dives with a health scores as low as the IQ level of the burnt cheeto in office. 

When I read that there was a new hot pot place on San Bruno Avenue, I dragged my sister to come try it with me. By day, Chef Li's Cafe, is your standard Chinese restaurant with roasted ducks (looked bomb), soy sauce chicken, bbq pork, etc hanging at the window. You can also order the typical Chinese rice plates, noodle dishes, and clay pot items. By night, it's AYCE hot pot for $22.99 which includes apps (chicken wings, curry balls, five-spice beef shank), "dim sum" (pot stickers, green onion pancake, housemade dumplings), dessert (mantou), and milk tea: http://bit.ly/2tds5uK. Kids under 3 are free. Kids 10 and under are free. Seniors are $19.99. Reservations accepted.

They allowed for hot pot during lunch with reservations so we went during lunch time (same price as dinner). 

For hot pot, you can choose individual pots or do half/half. They have 17 broths and all contain some msg. I told our server about my msg sensitivity and she kindly suggested the pork bone soup which has the least msg. We did a half/half pot with #1 Special Spicy Soup (mala) and #2 Pork Bone Soup: http://bit.ly/2sT731z and http://bit.ly/2tcOb0b. 

(+) Huge variety of hot pot items (check off on a list): meats, offal, seafood, seafood & meat balls, dumplings, several tofu varieties, veggies and mushrooms, noodles, rice cakes, etc. 
(+) Meats were super fresh and pretty good quality for the price. Fav: New Zealand Lamb and American Wagyu (limit 1 plate pp). 
(+) Loved the beef tongue...they pre-cook it so it's super soft. 
(+) Housemade shrimp wonton was packed with fresh, crunchy shrimp. 
(+)  Light msg usage for the Pork Bone Soup. No cotton ball mouth afterwards.
(+) The mala broth had good numbing flavor but I could taste the msg. If I didn't have my stupid msg sensitives, I would have enjoyed this one. My sister liked it. 
(+) Sauce bar with a good variety of sauces include beef drippings and raw egg: http://bit.ly/2tdZlCk. If you're sensitive to msg like myself stick with the peanut butter, chili oil, sriracha, cilantro, jalapeno. 
(+) Fried mantou (made to order) with condensed milk was the perfect ending to this meatfest: http://bit.ly/2tdQxMA.

(-) We ordered some items that never came; e.g. duck tongue.  
(-) Housemade shrimp paste had a weird, mushy texture. 
(-) Fish ball with fish roe had no fish roe filling.  
(-) The beef balls had a strange elastic texture. 
(-) Milk tea was pre-made in a pitcher and tasted from the powder variety. 
(-) No booze. 

The fine print: 90 minute limit (+$10 for each 30 minutes thereafter), $20 pp charge for uneaten food, 1 credit card per a table. 

The servers were really nice and attentive which is a rarity for a Chinese restaurant. They even offered to make us some special sauces from the sauce bar. The call their male customers "handsome" in Cantonese which I thought was cute. I didn't want to be Captain Obvious and do a 180 to see if they were really cute. Though, I totally would have after couple of shots. 

Chef Li's Cafe is bright and pretty spacious (I think this used to be a copy shop?). There's about 10-12 two and four tops, and 2 six tops. Restrooms are clean. 

Parking can be tough in the area but the 8 and 54 line bus stops are right there. 

Chef Li's Café is such a welcome addition to Portola (no more trekking to Richmond or Sunset for your hot pot craving) and you really can't beat the price. 4.5 stars rounded up.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
My first time at a Hot Pot Restaurant and I would say this place seemed decent and exceptional to me!! Do not be fooled by the looks of this restaurant even though it looks a bit janky. 

I wanna start off with a quick story before going on with this review -- My friends and I had decided eat here for the first time as it is still fairly new, also with it being 'Buffet Style Hot Pot'....which I did not pay attention to. As it was time to give our order, plates and plates of Hot Pot components kept getting served to us....and my friends still wanted more. Therefore, they ordered 5 more plates of meat, which to mention, we had gone through 10 plates. I started freaking out because I thought the total of our Bill was going to be SKY HIGH expensive but then...I realized it was BUFFET STYLE. AHHH THE IDEA OF BUFFET STYLE HOTPOT IS A YESSS LOL.

Onto the review -- When you first walk in, you have to wait to be seated. I would say that it doesnt get too packed, however, the moment you are seated and eating, you'll begin to realize (most times) that the tables start to get filled up as time passes by. You will have stoves infront of you that you can control with a 1-5 setting heat (1 being the lowest of heat whereas 5 is boiling heat). 

The waitors give 1 menu per table, and the idea is to just mark off the quantity of what toppings and components you want, however, each person gives their own order of what Soup Base they want.You also can get FREE COMPLIMENTARY_FREE REFILL HOUSE MILK TEA :).There are about 5 different flavors and the Milk Teas have the perfect amount of sweetness/ are rich and creamy. How can I not ask for another refill?
MInd you, take advantage of the fact that this is an ALL YOU CAN EAT BUFFET STYLE HOT POT only for $22.99 per person. That is so cheap considering you can keep ordering A BUNCH  of plates to satisfy your hunger or cravings. 

***Now for the Cons: The reason why this review did not get a full 5 Star rating considering it seemed that I was leading towards a 5 star review......the service.

The staff are definitely polite and friendly, however, their service could be better. 

Whenever we needed more orders, of course we were patient, however, every time we raise our hand or show some sort of gesture to get their attention.....the staff are just not with it and can be slow. 

Another downside is, the staff seems to primarily speak and understand Chinese...therefore It honestly was a struggle to ask for certain things or requests aside from them just having to look at our menu to see what we wanted. 

What threw me off BIG TIME was my friend asked for water, and we expected a new fresh cup just like any other restaurant would if we had already used the cup with another drink. The lady just decided to pour the water into the cup we had already used, which was filled with Milk Tea......we asked for another Cup and she said we could not have one. Quite upsetting actually now that I look back on it.  

I honestly would still recommend this place. You definitely will get your money's worth.
author: Stacey M.

description:
Now this is the best spot for Hot Pot on San Bruno avenue and maybe Portola  district of San Francisco overall. You get even more what you pay for here, it's not expensive and no where else can match the quality of what you're getting.
The beef platter comes with a load of good quality fatty beef and tendon as well as another cut. The Jasmine drink is delightful and refreshing. It's good, it's the best and that's all I have to say about that.
author: Dylan S.

description:
Review is only for the "all you can eat buffet" element of this restaurant.  I cannot speak upon anything beyond that.  The following is just my opinion, and that's exactly all it is.  It's not right, nor is it wrong.  Just my opinion.

I really wanted to like this place.  I really, really did.  

First thing to note: according to their policy, you only get 90 minutes for the "all you can eat".  Think about that for a minute.

Second note: came here on the weekend.  We were very much excited to try Chef Li's and got there a little bit after the buffet began.  Got a seat right away as there was not a whole lot of people there yet.  We got the menu and began our selections.  Round one was about to commence!  Got our milk teas right away, but the first round of food took a little bit to come out, and missed a few items that we ordered.  

As we began eating, crowds started to come into the restaurant and it was noticeably busier.  One thing we observed was that at the time, there were really only 2 individuals helping everyone with the service.  An additional employee was behind the counter handling the checkout process.  The thing about an "all you can eat" buffet is that service is constantly needed at various tables for various reasons, but that definitely was not happening since they obviously were short staffed.  We were almost done with round 1, and wanted to begin ordering for round 2.  

After some wait, and pondering whether we were able to use some kind of dance to attract her attention, the waitress came back with the menu for round 2 and uttered something in the lines of "you might want to get everything now".  We started to realize that this is truly not an "all you can eat" buffet because we were really under a lot of pressure from time constraints and not only that, limited servicing.  Round 2 took extremely long to get out, and again missed a few items we ordered.  The most surprising part (which was also the most disappointing), is that it took us an immensely long time to get a second round of milk teas (which we ordered on the menu).  It wasn't until a third employee came on the floor that we were able to get that second round.  

Now, onto the quality of the food.  All the seafood is pretty standard, but it was the meat that shocked me the most.  The meats were really not all that great (in my opinion), and quite frankly all tasted the same.  There was this interesting taste to them, that I cannot pinpoint exactly what it is.  The broth was sub par, but the noodles (which for some odd reason took an hour to come out, and two order tries) were solid.  My favorite part of the meal were the milk teas.  That was truly the most on point item they had.  

Would I go there again?  Not really.  For $23+ dollars, I can honestly say I did not get my money's worth.  I can only presume certain things about this place, and I will keep that to myself.  However, if you're looking to roll the dice, you may want to give it a try.
author: Bernie C.

description:
I came with a group of friends on a Friday night to try out the new AYCE hot pot in town. Literally 2 walking blocks from my house. I can see crowds of people here once they see the $22.99 AYCE option! I have been to a good amount of AYCE hot pot places before--there are good and bad ones. This one is actually GREAT for the price. Meat quality is definitely freshly sliced to order. We had plenty orders of beef (rib eye & wagyu), lamb, and pork! They also have appetizers--really enjoyed the green onion pancake and the fried buns with condensed milk OMG! I also loved the cold tripe plate, reminds of the szechuan cold app dishes- must order!

Broths that I liked was the spicy miso--has a good kick. Good for those who can do spicy but not too spicy. Tom Yum was delicious as well. If you don't like spicy the pork bone broths they offered were pretty flavorful!

There is also a sauce bar-I recommend using beef juice and beef sauce with spicy sauce and drizzle of the peanut sauce that's light brown along with garlic, scallions, green onions, and cilantro BOMB. They take 4 hours to make their own sauces at the bar so definitely check it out! i will be back soon!
author: Alice Z.

description:
I went here a total of two times. The first time was pretty upsetting, because I was the only table available and I still couldn't get my food in a timely manner. However, it was close to closing time so I thought that maybe I'd give them a chance at an earlier time.

Big mistake. Though the restaurant was fuller, the service  was not much different than the first time. This place is a hotpot place so you order what you want on a menu and it comes out for you to cook. However, out of the three times we ordered, my friend and I only received half the items. We thought maybe they ran out of items? It would have still been nice to know.

Next, our food items came very sparsely in some areas and abundant in others. We got the end parts of noodles and our meat came out in small pieces of six, but they gave an excess of veggies and deep fried foods to the point where we couldn't finish them. They also started running out of food at 8pm, two hours before closing. Their sauce bar was not correctly labeled so it was confusing to make sauces. It was overall a mess. They also took 10-15 minutes to come out with food and they never checked up on our table unless we asked.

However, parking is never hard (+1) and their milk tea is also unlimited and delicious (+1). However, their bubble milk tea ran out by the time we got there (7pm).

Overall, I wouldn't come back. I'd much rather spend my money on a place where I can receive my food in a timely manner with all the food I ordered. A meal that takes an hour took us about two hours due to slow service.
author: Hannah C.

description:
San Bruno Avenue's first hot pot restaurant! It was pretty cheap since it was all you can eat for $22.99/person and milk tea included! They have 17 different flavors, I chose secret spicy soup and special curry soup. Both of the broths were okay, it wasn't that flavorful. I wish their secret spicy soup was actually spicier. I ordered 3 plates of New Zealand Lamb, 3 plates of American Wagyu Beef, 1 plate of beef rib eye, 1 plate of house special spicy lamb, and 1 plate of house special spicy beef. 

The New Zealand Lamb and Wagyu beef tasted nearly the same..  It wasn't bad but I didn't see anything special between them. 

Beef rib eye just tasted like every other beef. 

Okay, now the house special spicy lamb and spicy beef weren't spicy at all. Both of the meat had this red watery sauce on top of it and black pepper. 

This is an ok restaurant but the hot pots in Sunset district are better.
author: Kristi A.

description:
First time coming here and we are fairly dissapointed. We were left with the menu for 10-15 min and after trying to flag down a server 3 times, someone finally came over to answer our questions. And we were the only customers theres besides a chinese couple in another table who turned out to also work there. 3 plates of meat came and we were left waiting for the rest of our order (veggie and fish ball) for a long time. Clams was not fresh, tasted grainy. We were not offered water or tea when we sat down. 1 order of watercress was enough to feed a family of 5. Way too much!

We did get the free milk tea though after the server explained the menu to use. 

Tip: order the meats, that's why you're here. Don't get distracted by their variety of fishballs which were just so so.
author: Emily P.

description: Slow service. You would think that after about a month of opening that they would realize they need more help. They barely had 4 tables that night and it was still so slow
author: Long C.

description:
Great place to enjoy hot pot dining. 

The food is fresh and they have many different broths to choose from.The menu is loaded with many choices , appetizers and the milk teas are delicious.  

The best part about this restaurant is their great service! 

The price is fair but the quality of the food and service makes this place an exceptional find close to home. 

I will definitely return with my friends and family!
author: Eric C.

description: Price is decent and the food is fresh and authentic! I really like this place because they have HK BBQ and hot pot so if you like both, it's the place for you. They also have wide range of soup base options. But I would say the service is a little bit slow when it gets crowded.
author: Xu C.

description: New hot pot in SF. Very good price $22 per person all you can eat. Many choice of hot pot items. No waiting Monday night. Good service.
author: Michael W.

description:
Overall                7/10
Environment       9/10. Clean and comfortable place
Variety.                8/10. A lot more choices 
Price.                   9/10. Decent price for AYCE
Broth.                   5/10. Editable
Food(freshness). 5/10. The beef is frozen, they gave us small amount each time.
 Sauce bar.           6.5/10 kinda a lot but not fresh
Service.                 7/10 was okay the ladies try to help

I went there with my boyfriend, decided to have hotpot, my boyfriend love this place cuz the environment! It's a perfect restaurant for him. But I am more like a food person, I can understand why ppl give 5star on Yelp, I believe their food is pretty awesome And theres A LOT OF CHOICES!!!!! And the price is very reasonable in San Francisco! But my review is for the hotpot ONLY! We waited like 10 minuets for the food to come, first the broth is very disappointing, second ! We ordered a chicken wing and they gave me TWO pieces??? (Same as the fishball they gave me four)third, their drink is 4star' that's pretty friendly rating! Well, $24 can't expect much, I'm being to greedy . But we had stomach ache after the hot pot. 

It's definitely a good place to go for hot pot! I don't need to go to IPOT anymore, that's decent! And I had nail polish right across the street! I will recommend this restaurant for my friend for that price! Even for their food! I saw on menu $6for lunch box , pretty cool!
author: Yanxin C.

description: Great service here. We went to this all you can eat hot pot place on a raining night. The meat is good with a big selection of balls and cold dishes. I really enjoyed the dinner there. The only thing to complain is parking....
author: Junce Z.

description:
I love coming here for all you can eat hot pot cause it's close to home and very reasonably priced. The name of the business will not give it away that this is a hot pot place but give it a try! 

They have a pretty wide selection of meats, appetizers, soups and sauces. They even offer all you can drink boba! 

I usually go for the half and half soup with Thai and the pork bone broth. So yummy! They have very fresh meats and good variety. However they are a bit disorganized. The servers usually do not tell you what everything is and sometimes you don't get everything you order. The portions here are rather small which I'm not mad about because my eyes are usually bigger than my stomach and it allows me to try more things on the menu! One thing- I usually LOVE beef tongue but the beef tongue they serve here is cooked instead of raw and it's rather thick. Makes me wonder if it really is beef tongue :( 

They have a sauce bar towards the back of the restaurant and they have so many yummy sauces! Try putting together a few things to create the perfect spice and taste!
author: Lushi Z.

description: Been here twice with co-workers - once for hot pot and once for family style dishes. Both were delicious. Friendly helpful staff. I will be coming here again.
author: H M.

description: Great selection and friendly staff. Fair price for all you can eat. Going forward, definitely will be one of our top hot pot choices in SF!
author: Ran X.

description:
This is my favorite hot pot place and I've been to a lot. The service is great and the food is fresh. They get busy sometimes so try to go earlier or make a reservation. There is also a huge amount of choices when it comes to broth, veggies, meats and other toppings. I love how you can get your individual hot pot or share a huge one with your entire group. They're also very generous with their sauce options. Their hot pot option comes with unlimited milk tea which is a nice touch!

Aside from the delicious hot pot meal, their roasted pig is amazing. You can order it in the front of the store. It easily ranks as one of the top roasted pig I've ever had. Trendy and juicy!

I can't wait to come back and satisfy my hot pot cravings!   I'm so glad there's finally a great hot pot place in this area!
author: Jenny T.

description: Love the food, but don't like the wait, when they are busy they forgot to bring your food
author: London L.

description:
I like how home-y this place feels for all you can eat hot pot. Because this restaurant has a more mom & pop vibe and isn't overrated with a bunch of hype, it felt like I was more supporting a local business than one of those popular must-try hot pot places in the city. For $23 before tax & tip you have a wide selection of broths to choose from, meats, vegetables, dumplings, noodles and all you can drink milk tea (say what?) 

My sister and I had a date here on a Friday night where there was no crowds or anything and we were looking forward to eating a good meal together. We were seated at a 4 person table with their own burner so instead of us being able to get a split broth pot, we instead got our own broth pot and got to try each others. After reading reviews, I chose the pork bone broth and my sister got the tom yum. I would totally recommend the pork bone broth! It was super soothing for a cold day. We ordered a LOT of food; I would recommend getting the new zealand lamb & wagyu beef for sure and any of their housemade dumplings. Everything else like the veggies and noodles are pretty standard and are usually offered at other hotpot restaurants. They have a DIY sauce bar and even an option to dump an egg into your soup! The milk tea is pretty good however it tasted more like using the powder mixture rather than using real tea leaves.

Downsides of this place: the service isn't the best, as we saw about two waitresses running around to all the tables even when the place wasn't overly crowded. We had to flag them down to get our orders in. As I requested certain items (i.e. the bok choy), they substituted for another item without letting us know they ran out; it wasn't until I mentioned it to them that they told me they didn't have anymore so they decided to give us something else. For the most part despite the downsides, I think this place is good to get your AYCE  hotpot fix at a reasonable price.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
The pros: uncrowded on weeknights, a short drive away from my apartment, and cheaper than other hot pot places in the city. The con: low-quality meat.

 I got the bone broth soup, which was quite good, especially on a chilly winter evening. There is a lot of variety for the vegetables and meat that you can order. The vegetables were all very fresh (I ate at least 200 enoki mushrooms), but I was pretty disappointed with the quality of the meat relative to other hot pot places I've been to.

Tip #1: It's hard to find parking in this area. We had to circle a few times and park a few blocks away. 

Tip #2: There's a massive sauce bar where you can compose your own sauce masterpiece. I went with the classic soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and green onions, but the possibilities are endless! 

Overall: The location of Chef Li's is convenient and it comes at a better price point than most other places in SF, but because of the low-quality meat, I'd go to other places in SF rather than coming back.
author: Sarah W.

description: Slow service.  Poor quality meat.  It's fairly cheap at $23.99, but you get what you pay for.  I would definitely not come back.
author: Henry Y.

description: Food is fresh and yummy! Prices are awesome, service is great, and it's super clean!!
author: Deena M.

description:
AYCE hot pot within 5 mins from home? I'm there!

This place opened recently (re-opened under new management and added the hot pot portion?) and I heard about it from word of mouth.
Came here on a Friday evening and there was little to no wait.

For $22.99, it's all you can eat and drink (Thai, Taro, Jasmine, or bubble milk tea). You can choose to have your own little pot and get your own broth or a big pot to share.

I typically get the coconut pork bone soup base. Soup base tastes great and is easy on your stomach (haha).

Anyways this place is usually understaffed. There's literally like 2 people serving (1 takes care of the front, where they take orders/sell Chinese food and helps out with the hot pot portion of the restaurant occasionally). A lot of the servers are somewhat new and they seem to panic a bit when it gets busy.

On to the food:
The food in my opinion is so-so. The quality of their meat is decent but I've definitely had better. For $22.99, I honestly did not expect much so I came in not expecting much. They give you about 5 slices of meat for every order so order a lot before they get busy. Everything else is what they'd typically have at any ordinary hot pot. 

4 stars for the quality and the price of the AYCE hot pot. I would definitely be back to satisfy those hot pot cravings. Decent food and easy on the wallet.

**Cash & Credit accepted
***Residential parking a few blocks away behind San Bruno Ave, street metered parking on San Bruno Ave.
author: Johnny G.

description: AYCE hot pot, milk tea, and appetizer for only $22.99? That's such a great deal! Usually AYCE hot pot can go up to $26+, so Chef Li's was well worth it. The restaurant was clean and nicely decorated with a mix of traditional Chinese and modern aesthetic. Our waitress was lovely and genuinely cared about the customers. She was instructing me on the best way to eat hot pot, showing me where the sauce bar is, and explaining the ordering system. She alone gets 5 stars! The food was pretty solid as well. Veggies were fresh and meat was tender. We had the thai tea and bubble tea, both of which were satisfying. Overall, I had a fulfilling experience and would not hesitate to come back!
author: Amanda T.

description:
$22.99 for AYCE hot pot and some varietals of milk tea. Like Ariel stated the menu (with broths) are very similar to iPot. Also,  note that there is only hot pot, and the wagyu you can get is limited. The nice thing about it is that it is affordable, and the portions are consistent. At other hot pot places, I never know the sizing of the portions, so I never know how much to actually order. With Chef Li's, they  use the same plates for all the meats, so you know portioning is consistent. They do mostly offer hot pot at dinner, but if you call ahead of time and ask, they will allow you to eat it at lunch. They also take reservations, as long as you call in. However, only a couple of serves speak fluent English, so you're better off here if you can speak Cantonese or Mandarin. Many of the customers here also spoke Cantonese or Mandarin so it was legit. You can split broths as well-- and they have like 12 varietals of broth you can choose from. Meat quality is thawed or fresh, not frozen, which was awesome, and there was a whole ton of meat you could choose from. Our favorites were the wagyu beef, kurobuta pork belly, and the lamb! 

On our lunch visit, we got half spicy mala broth (which wasn't SUPER spicy-- but I'm sure you could ask them to make it that way if you wanted) and half miso broth. Both were excellent, and yes, they do refill, even without you asking! While they say there is a time limit, it was not strictly enforced during lunch-- though dinner may be different. Service is hit or miss, as they are super busy and like I said, the language barrier may be difficult for people who want someone who is super attentive, but for the most part, it's standard hot pot service. The sauce bar is also super dope and have cool sauces like beef juice (au jus drippings, I guess) as well as housemade spicy sauce (delicious! my favorite seriously) and housemade mushroom sauce. The sauce bar alone is a reason I'd recommend it. The milk tea is also worth it ,though the stock pictures show that they come with boba, and they definitely don't. In any case, it's worth coming here. We also enjoyed their scallion pancakes (super crispy and thin!) as well as their fried mantou with condensed milk. Yummmmmmmy! 

My BF and I are super happy to have found Chef Li's, as it is our new to-go hot pot place since it's much closer than the majority of the other AYCE hotpot places in the city.
author: Christa Lei S.

description:
We had driven up from Los Angeles over the Labor Day weekend to see our daughter.
Saturday evening we decided to try this place, since she had been there before, and liked it. I was a little concerned, since it was AYCE. That concern was misplaced!

We got the spicy miso and the Chinese herb soup base. Lots of vegetables, wontons, lamb and pork belly for proteins. No beef.

The food came out pretty fast. The sauce bar was very extensive, and very good.
The original order for the four of us was sufficient. They came back to ask for what we wanted next, and was majorly surprised when we said we were full!

Service was very friendly, and prompt. When we left, the two waitpersons standing outside said goodbye!

I would definitely go back, if I am in that neck of the woods.
author: Siddharth D.

description:
$22.99 for AYCE hotpot.

Meat choice and quality: pretty fresh and is way bette than the little sheep in union square. However, when I ordered 2 plates of wagyu, the two plates looked drastically different. I also loved the clams; they did a good job to clean them. All the homemade fish/meat balls are delicious. Standard selection of veggies. I don't like eating carb so we didn't order anything like noodles.

Sauce station: the bomb. They even provide raw egg as a dipping.

4 types of milk come with the $22.99. But we were too full to try it.

Lastly, the whole reason that we came here is that they have the fried bun with condensed milk. I rarely eat carbs but I cannot say no to these perfectly fried crispy buns
author: Ruxin H.

description:
Variety 4 out of 5
Service 3 out of 5
Food 3 out of 5
Value 4 out of 5

I always like to try "Hot and New Restaurants" because depending on how anticipated the opening of the restaurant is, you tend to have a lighter wait if your chef isn't one of the celebrity chef that foodies would follow. With that being said, Frank and I decided to try Chef Li's Cafe in San Bruno because it was 6 PM on a Sunday night and we did not want to wait 2 hours to be seated and then get home late because we both have work tomorrow. In my opinion, San Bruno or Daly City falls to be my go-to areas to look for food when I want to avoid the lines and waitlist. With that being said, we arrived at the location around 6:30 PM and was seated about 5 minutes after (they took some time to clean up a table for us). 

This place seems to have everything from your roasted meat and poultry to family style dinner and all you can eat hot pot. Frank and I opted in for the all you can eat hot pot because Frank wanted something with a lot of meat, whereas I was craving soup (a nice win for the both of us)! The place have about 8-10 small tables and 3-4 large tables that can seat about 6-10 people. Each table have the hot pot system installed. I would say, with the installation, the tables become rather thick, therefore, for tall people, you might run into the problem where the table becomes too low for you and would touch your knees. I ran into the problem where I could not cross my legs because the table was low (and I'm only 5'2". The place was bright and looks clean. Upon receiving our menu, we were told that we are getting complimentary bubble tea options of our choice (milk tea, or Thai tea). I assume this is a promotional add on for their grand opening. 

I don't know whether the hosts and waiters saw Frank and I as Asians and just assumed we spoke Chinese or if they did not know English (the waiters) but they kept speaking Chinese to us even after we told them that we do not speak Chinese. The host spoke limited Chinese, which was fine for us to order and get our food and check. 

The all you can eat hot pot is 22.99 per person (which is about average around the area). There is a big selection of what is included from (lamb, beef, pork, chicken, clams, mussels, shrimp, fish and meatballs) similar to other hot pot location. I would say though that they have a quite a big selection of soup base that you can choose from and appetizer and dim sum is included in the all you can eat (most locations do not include appetizer or even dim sum).

For appetizer, I got the chicken wings as I love wings and can't live without them. The wings were called 5-spice wings but really tasted like salt, pepper and other light seasoning and then fried. The wings were good but they did not taste like 5-spice wings in my opinion. 

For the hotpot, we got spicy miso soup and kimchi soup. The spicy miso tasted like the Chinese spicy soup mixed with Miso and the kimchi tasted like Chinese spicy soup with kimchi. It was still good but definitely not what I expected for each type of soup. As for the meat, we went with the wagyu beef, spicy lamb, spicy beef, beef tripe, beef tongue, quail eggs, spicy fish filet, New Zealand Mussels, Clams, cuttlefish balls and beef balls. We got a few vegetable as well to justify our healthy choices (watercress, boy choy and mushrooms). Everything we ordered was great and it was relatively fresh. The spicy lamb was surprisingly good as I am a bit skeptical at times when lamb is prepared for an all you can eat place as they tend to still have a smell attached to them. The spicy lamb did not have the bad smell attached to them at all and was pretty good. The seafood was pretty good, it wasn't fresh out of the sea but it wasn't frozen to the point where you can tell by tasting it that it has been frozen forever. 

I would definitely come back to this place for their hot pot and maybe try their barbecue section next time as well. I love the fact that there was practically no wait to get a table for hot pot unlike in the city where you could be waiting for an hour or two at a hot pot place that have about 20+ tables. This place is also great for accommodating larger parties as well and it seemed like there is not a big wait to accommodate large parties. I would say, if this place have grill and hot pot, it would be one of my go to spot for hot pot and grill for the no wait and decent food.

I give this place a 3.5 out of 5 because the variety is amazing here, especially if you were to come with a lot of people that have different Chinese food cravings. The service is ok, but I wished they have more English speaking servers. The food was good based but basically what you can get in most hot pot places. The value was definitely there for the hot pot though because you pay $23 a person to get hot pot, appetizer and dim sum, which is more selection that I expected and the price was pretty average.
author: Chenny O.

description:
For those who have been to iPot in Sunset, this is basically iPot. I'm not sure if its the same owner, if it's not, there's probably a lawsuit on the way lol. The menu is exactly the same! A few differences, the price is lower here, 22.99 for ayce, milk tea is included (regular, jasmine, taro), and there is no half pot half grill option, instead of ice cream they give you a popsicle at the end. The meat quality was good and the service was decent, I will admit the service is a little slower here vs. iPot, there are only 1.5 servers currently. We came at an odd hour for lunch/dinner so the service was not too bad and we got our meat in a reasonable time. 

Overall, if you don't want to wait for a table at iPot and don't mind not having grilled meat, I recommend coming here.
author: Ariel N.

description:
Where should I even start? The soup base taste is fresh made and all the sauces are very good as well! Most important thing is ALL the food is very fresh. The people who work inside are nice and quick. I will definitely go back again soon.
P.S:  My daughter's favorites were the fried buns with condensed milk and the quail eggs. She also liked the style of the restaurant. She said it looks very simple and clean!
author: Jolene C.

description:
I am a huge fan of hot pot in general so when a group of friends suggested we should try Chef Li's Cafe AYCE hot pot, you know I was the first one to say yes. There were many options to choose from with regards to broth. The four broths my friends and I got were: Spicy Miso, Tom Yum, Pork Bone, and Salty Pork Bone with Winter Melon. Out of these broths, I really enjoyed the Tom Yum. Not too spicy and not too sour, this broth brought all of the food I cooked inside to a whole new level. The menu itself was extremely extensive. If you're a fan of variety, you have to check this place out! Besides the countless kinds of meats, tofus, vegetables, fish/beef balls, and noodles they offered, their appetizer list (which is also AYCE) was amazing as well. 

HIGHLIGHTS: exceptional meat quality (lamb was my favorite), very tasty appetizers (5-spice chicken wings and potstickers were my favorite), SAUCE BAR

The sauce bar deserves its own section in this review. I always look forwards to customizing my own sauces at hot pot restaurants and when I saw this sauce bar, I was instantly impressed. Not only does this sauce bar have your traditional selections (peanut sauce, sesame sauce, bean curd, soy sauce, scallions, garlic, etc.) but there are also many selections which were created by the main chef. These customized sauces included: a mushroom paste sauce (my favorite), a special spicy sauce, and a beef broth sauce.

Service is typically not great at AYCE hot pot restaurants so I do want to point out that the service here was phenomenal! The waitresses were attentive and friendly, and always making sure we had everything we needed. One of the chefs even came out to double check on us to make sure we were not only enjoying our food but having a great time doing so. Nice touch!
author: Jason T.

description:
Glad there is finally an AYCE hotspot place in the area. You get what you pay for at this place. 

The selection of meat and various soups makes this place great if you really like hotpot. I was surprised they included appetizers, desserts and milk teas in the AYCE menu. 

The quality of the food is exceptional. I was impressive with the quality of the meat. The quality and taste was definitely there if you can tell the difference. 

If you're looking for an AYCE hotpot place in the area..this is the place!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Pleasantly surprised!!! Food was tasty.  The meats were very high quality cuts and slices. Was not frozen at all. The veggies were fresh and crisp. The appetizers were in par and it came with free milk tea.

Bonus for being close to the neighborhood.. parking was not too bad.

Great find for being a hike in the wall. AYCE for the boys at $22.99 was well worth it. They stopped after 8 plates of meat.

I would recommend a stop if you want a change.
author: robert C.

description: This is my first time here. And I think this was my last time dinner here too.  They serve us unfresh chicken(re-cooked/over cooked). We can't finish the rice, I was asking a togo box for the rice. The Mandarin waitress told me there will be extra charge if we take the rice for togo. What?! I thought we already pay for the rice! Every food on our table should be able to take home when we can't finish it. She said rice is so expensive, so they need to charge extra money for togo. Is that means you are going to reuse our rice for other customers?!
author: Vanessa L.

description: I was here last week with my buddy for AYCE and everything started out ok. Then things took a weird turn when one of the workers was clearing out my plates. He attempted to swipe my iPhone charger until I stopped him in the act. Later when I asked for more meat, another server gave my buddy and I a huge attitude. I was like WTF this is an AYCE!? If you have an issue with two dudes ordering a ton of food, then don't advertise for an AYCE business. The food was average but the service was the worst ever! We were pissed and gave them one dime for tips! They deserved every dime.
author: Sunny L.

description: Hot Pot first timer. We had the AYCE and tried many options, all good! the staff are friendly and all smiles. Definitely will come back again
author: Dennis C.

description:
Exceptional all around. Had hot pot which is all you can eat. Good quality meats. Very friendly service. Milk tea comes with hot pot. Pork bone soup was so good. They make alot of their own sauces which is friggin delicious. 

Gonna go nap now...

10/10 coming back again
author: Alan L.

description:
The best AYCE hotpot in San Bruno Ave!! Come with 17 kind of soup base that you can choose to get half-half or personal pot. Tonight we got pork bone broth and mushroom that was so mild and delicious even sip alone.Good quality of meat also the option of seafood. Also have appetizer and dessert that I'm really love fried bun with condensed milk and fried wonton. they also have dipping sauce bar that you can mix dipping sauce on your own :) servers are really nice and cheerful , give them 10/10 will coming back for sure.
They also have ready to eat and Chinese food, that I really interested to get some in the other day.
author: Swisshaya K.

description:
Since so many reviews have already highlighted the hot pot, I'm going to focus on the other dishes you can order, which have blown me away compared to the other restaurants along San Bruno Ave. We came a couple times and ordered a variety of dishes and everything was fresh and really tasty. Some highlights:

- stir fry clams in black bean sauce (not on menu)
- kombucha squash and teriyaki beef stir fry
- bitter melon chicken (alright! I admit I like bitter melon!)
- bok choy beef HK fried noodle
- most rice plates are only less than 7 bucks!

On one occasion, we ordered 2 main dishes (with seafood and beef) and a noodle and the total came to less than 30. Great value....And they cook it for you too! 

Overall, great food at a good price!
author: V C.

description:
I came here with my buddy after 1:00PM. Because I wanted to try out their hot pot. But a lovely lady works here told me, hot pot would takes a long time to make. She advised me next time called ahead if I want AYCE hot pot. OK! I was disappointed but I guess I try out their other food.

We ordered 3 dishes, combo fried rice, BBQ pork, won ton noodle. All for $25, that's pretty price. 

This restaurant is good for lunch with a group of people. If you're a kind of person would like to enjoy peaceful lunch time. You not gonna like this restaurant. They speaks in Chinese and it's loud.
author: T B.

description: Came right when they opened for hot pot and there was only one table.  They took our drink and broth order.  Gave us our drinks and took the checked menu.  We received the broth and about two-thirds of what we checked off.  Best part was the appetizers - potstickers and roasted pork belly...which I wish I had order more of to throw in to the soup...guarantee it will give the broth flavor, which was pretty lacking and tasteless to begin with.  TIP- make sure you mark down everything you want and how much, because they don't come back at all once most of your items are dropped off.  They were really hard to wave down.  We actually received the other table's shrimp and egg roll order.  More ppl arrived while we were there, along with two parties. So while I want to be understanding, my experience there wasn't great considering what I paid and what I actually received. I wouldn't go again.
author: Maysee V.

description: Large portions, very delicious. Hole in the wall, family owned restaurant. Their sweet and sour pork is very delicious and addictive lol.
author: Alejandra R.

description:
Love them! Sometimes we have a communication issue, but overall the staff were nice to us. 
We tried all the meat section and they were superb. The good thing was the selected drinks were included! It was a great experience.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Very nice and wide selections, the servers also super welcoming & humble. This resto is my new hot pot spot
author: Patricia N.

description: Well priced all you can eat hotpot.  Meat is not frozen, included bubble tea, hot appetizer choices. Variety of homemade choices, especially fish balls is better than most.  This is likely my now goto hotpot place.
author: Paul C.

description: I'm so glad there is a hot pot place near me. Not only that, but it is pretty yummy as well. All of our food was very fresh.
author: Mihwa K.

description:
Not bad for a hot pot place. However, hard to find parking. They also raise the price to $23.99 which is still decent considering the price include unlimited milk tea.  

Service was just okay. We went when it was just only us and we still got the same service as if there was a lot of customers. Once in the restaurant, they will speak to you in Mandarin first which I don't understand. Also, it's hard to get the waitress attention. They never come to ask if we need refills or want to order more food. We are always the one that have to flag them down and ask. 

They also have a tendency to skip some of your orders and not tell you about it. I would greatly appreciate it if some thing I mark is no longer available, please let me know so that I don't have to keep wondering if that missing order will come soon.

Food quality  : 4 stars
Atmosphere : 3 stars
Parking : 1 star
Price : 4 stars
Service : 2.5 stars
Will I go back? Yes.
author: Bear B.

description: Oh my yum! Great ingredients and very friendly service. We went here for lunch and will defiantly come back. We've had hot pot several times before but the sauce bar really stood out. I've never seen a sauce bar and all their sauces are home made.
author: Jm C.

description:
I was excited about this place, i know it was a must visit. Any day for shabu hot pot is a yass in sf... 
.
So i called ahead and asked if they offer it during lunch and she confirmed it yes! Next was on a mission to here with the awkward lyft driver. 
.
As soon as i step my foot in here i was like I'm hungry.... sat me down at a table. All tables were for 4 and have a individual stove on there. The tables were kind of uncomfortable for the leg space and room, due to the table frame. 
.
They give you a erasable laminated menu with dry erase pen. If only one person you get one broth and a small bowl. If 2 person you get bigger bowl with 2 broth to choose. 
.
They have a big section for veggies, spinach, a choy, tong choy, lettuce, and etc. Perfect for vegans and vegetarian. 
.
Meat section they have lamb, beef, and etc. But i find it a bit thick cut to shabu. I also discovered that the the spicy lamb and spicy beef was a thinner cut, so i ordered that over and over. 
.
They had a variety of miscellaneous items such as dim sum and i just skipped that since it was only me eating. Also can't forget all them pork, beef, fish, meatballs with or without fillings in them. As well tripe and all the nasty bits they offer too. 
.
The hot pot soup i chose was tom yum thai soup. The flavor wasnt all there. Wasnt hot or sour. The owner apologized that they were short handed and she made it. Everything else was good. 
.
I also like the sauce station for you to make your own shabu sauce and because gotta keep it saucy. They offered ginger scallion, soy sauce, peanut butter, mushroom sauce, beef soy sauce, seaseme oil, and etc. I find that most of the sauces were thick in a paste like so you will have to mix it all with soy sauce to thin the sauce out. 
.
Overall i had a great experience. Surprisingly the server was very nice and polite. She kept busy and was on her toes to bring me stuff. They are short staffed and still improving so it was good for 1st time. As well the buffet hot pot was only 22.99 which was reasonable.  Also comes with 5 different choices of milk tea on the house with the buffet. But mines never came, but it was ok. Thanks for reading and keep on eating!  
.
Overall
author: Alex T.

description: Omg! We had our initial first few dishes and couldn't get a waiter to come by after. This is going to our last time coming here. Food is not bad, if you ever get your service and round of food. ,
author: Jennie C.

description: I don't want to push me every time I come. I sit down at 8:50 today, but the service in purple clothes always makes me hurry. Why?that's why?this is second time ? That guy alway say the kitchen will be close .but I just sit down less five mins ,omg so I wrote down include paid 80$ total with the tip !So I don't want to give more tips, very rude
author: GD C.

description:
I noticed this new 'all-you-can-eat' Hot Pot restaurant listed on Yelp so decided to give it a try with my husband.

We were both surprised it included appetizer, dim sum, and milk tea as part of all you can eat menu. 

We ordered lamb, beef and some vegetables. I really liked their lamb, and their vegetables were very (I mean REALLY REALLY) fresh. 

They also have a sauce-bar where you can mix & make your own dipping sauces which I liked a lot.

Overall, with the amount of money that we paid, the fresh food, and the greatly customer service, it definitely worth it.
author: Lily Hongmei S.

description: Attentive and friendly staff. I ordered food to go and was surprised when I took a look at the menu. The food was relatively inexpensive for the amount of food that you get. My beef chow fun and porridge order was only $12 and I had plenty of leftovers for another meal. The quality of the food was pretty good. While I was waiting for my order, the waitress offered me a free Asian dessert. I'll have to try a few more things on the menu before I bump up the rating to a 5.
author: W A.

description: Food is great, the place is clean and lots of choices for hotpot. The services are excellent. Hand made dumplings are must try.
author: Harry L.

description:
Must try their deep fried items. it is so crispy. We tried all even we have the ayce hot pot at night.

Recommend: sour napa soup base 
Improvement: better have a waitlist board up front
author: Zee Z.

description: Total $30 for all you can eat fresh meat and vegetables. Also they had a lot of different kinds of fish shrimp balls. My favorite was the shrimp balls with xo sauce in middle. I would come back. I had the kimchi soup and asked for it to be less spicy
author: Karen T.

description: Giving 5 stars just to support the restaurant since it's new, it still needs some improvement on food and service, believed as they run for while it will be better. Only hotpot on the neighborhood.
author: Qing L.

description: FINALLY, a hot pot place in the area! I am a huge fan of All You Can Eat, so when I discovered there was a new hot pot place in my neighborhood, I was beyond excited. I came with a party of 8 so we wanted to try EVERYTHING. At first glance of the menu, there were so many options. I was shocked that the AYCE included some dim sum, chicken wings, tripe, and so much more. Like what? All this for $22.99?? What a steal! We decided to try all the meat: different kinds of beef, lamb, pork, etc. Everything tasted so good. My personal favorite was the lamb. After indulging in the meat, my group felt guilty for not eating enough veggies, so we ordered all the veggies on the menu. Haha. So good, so fresh! I am so glad I came with such a big group because we had the chance to try everything. We also all ordered boba milk teas: thai, jasmine, and black tea. Overall great service and excellent food. This will be my new go-to hot pot place. Will probably be back every other week.
author: Michelle O.

description: Staff was very attentive from the moment my gf and I walked inside. Clean for a restaurant on San Bruno Ave. The AYCE hotpot menu has ton of options. Unlimited refill on milk teas was a huge a plus for me. We had the pork bone broth and the spicy surprise broth, both were fragrant and tasty. It was pretty packed for a Thursday night. We will be back since it is close by to us.
author: Davis X.

description: Great place for gathering. The staffs are very friendly. You have to try their red wine beef , red vine lamb , spicy beef and spicy lamb from the all you can eat hot pot. Highly recommended.
author: Yuming H.

description: Omg this place is sooooo good!! The options are amazing!!!!!!! There are soo many different appetizers! And it comes with unlimited milk tea! It's close by where I live. I haven't seen a restaurant that has a line around the area, besides Breakfast at Tiffany's
author: william z.

description: The soup was flavorless, I had to ask for salt to give it some flavor. The sauce selection is horrible and I really wish they had ponzu. I like that they had a big selection including dim sum items and appetizers but they weren't that great. The meat was ok and the veggies were fresh. Service was really bad, they don't really speak english so it was hard to ask them for stuff at times. I asked for something and the lady just looked at me confused and said "LATER". I would rather go a bit further for some better hot pot.
author: Tiffany T.

description: I like so far! Service can be a little better but overall, nice clean place and food was great. Love the selections of broth. Will come back!
author: Ann V.

description: Super slow service. $23/person for all you can eat hot pot is reasonable, but the waiting time to get your food and drinks is ridiculous. We came in at 7:45pm, and we got out at 9:30 and still felt hungry. They only took care of my table after the waitress had seen my $20 on the table with the timing clock running in my phone. They even forgot my order so we had to order it again. I would rather spend a little more at another hot pot restaurant in lieu of coming back here. Overall, this restaurant deserves 2 stars. 1. Reasonable price, 2. New/clean restaurant.
author: Vicent N.

description:
Haven't tried food of this place but there is something called humanity which I believe they lack! They charged for using just the restroom in an emergency situation.
Nevertheless, we purchased a coke and just left!
author: Pratiksha T.

description: If you order food to go, check your order before you leave. Twice, I've gotten something other than what I wanted.  Eating in is also a little disappointing, could have been better.  Could also be a language problem.
author: Carole L.

description:
Found this place through yelp and was not disappointed at all! The ayce hotpot is a great deal - we had some good quality beef, pork, and lamb slices, and who can say no to all-you-can-drink milk tea? 

Only thing that needs improvement is that they appear a little under-staffed, and tended to forget orders.
author: Gabriel T.

description:
$22.99 for AYCE shabu shabu in additional to certain milk teas (thai tea, regular milk tea, jasmine milk tea), AND dimsum appetizers. What's not to love?

Unlike other AYCE places, their prices are the same regardless if it's lunch or dinner and weekday or weekend. Plain and simple. You can order as much as you want in one round, so order to your hearts content (also so you won't have to call down a server again) and just don't waste food! Even if you do need to call down a server, the place is small enough that it's easy to catch one walking past your table.

From the appetizers, their fried dough with condensed milk is delicious - comes out steaming hot and crispy! Their chicken wings and chicken pop is also good. As for the shabu.. everything is delicious. I especially liked the fish ball with pork filling!
author: Lian M.

description: AYCE $22.99 per person. Kids 3 years old and under eats free. 10 years old and younger half off. Good quality meats served thaw not like other places where it's frozen. They serve seafood like shrimps, clam, mussels, squids. They also have appetizer like chicken wings, potstickers, green onion pancakes, Chinese donuts, all these are included for $22.99.
